verses.verse: Now it came<WH1961> about, when<WH3588> Isaac<WH3327> was old,<WH2204> and his eyes<WH5869> were too<WH4480> dim<WH3543> to see,<WH7200> that he called<WH7121> his older<WH1419> son<WH1121> Esau<WH6215> and said<WH559> to him, "My son.<WH1121>" And he said<WH559> to him, "Here<WH2009> I am."
And Isaac said,<WH559> "Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> I am<WH2204> old<WH2204> [and] I do not know<WH3045> the day<WH3117> of my death.<WH4194>
"Now<WH6258> then, please<WH4994> take<WH5375> your gear,<WH3627> your quiver<WH8522> and your bow,<WH7198> and go<WH3318> out to the field<WH7704> and hunt<WH6679> game<WH6718> for me;

and prepare<WH6213> a savory<WH4303> dish<WH4303> for me such<WH9201> as I love,<WH157> and bring<WH935> it to me that I may eat,<WH398> so<WH5668> that my soul<WH5315> may bless<WH1288> you before<WH2962> I die.<WH4191> "

And Rebekah<WH7259> was listening<WH8085> while Isaac<WH3327> spoke<WH1696> to his son<WH1121> Esau.<WH6215> So when Esau<WH6215> went<WH1980> to the field<WH7704> to hunt<WH6679> for game<WH6718> to bring<WH935> [home,]
Rebekah<WH7259> said<WH559> to her son<WH1121> Jacob,<WH3290> "Behold,<WH2009> I heard<WH8085> your father speak<WH1> to your brother<WH1696> Esau,<WH251> saying,<WH6215>

'Bring<WH935> me [some] game<WH6718> and prepare<WH6213> a savory<WH4303> dish<WH4303> for me, that I may eat,<WH398> and bless<WH1288> you in the presence<WH6440> of the Lord<WH3068> before<WH6440> my death.<WH4194>'
"Now<WH6258> therefore, my son,<WH1121> listen<WH8085> to me as I command<WH6680> you.

"Go<WH1980> now<WH4994> to the flock<WH6629> and bring<WH3947> me two<WH8147> choice<WH2896> kids<WH1423> <WH5795> from there,<WH8033> that I may prepare<WH6213> them [as] a savory<WH4303> dish<WH4303> for your father, such<WH1> as he loves.<WH9201>
"Then you shall bring<WH935> [it] to your father, that he may eat,<WH1> so<WH398> that he may bless<WH5668> you before<WH1288> his death.<WH6440>"
And Jacob<WH3290> answered<WH559> his mother<WH517> Rebekah,<WH7259> "Behold,<WH2005> Esau<WH6215> my brother<WH251> is a hairy<WH9617> man<WH376> and I am a smooth<WH2509> man.<WH376>
"Perhaps<WH194> my father will feel<WH1> me, then I shall be as a deceiver<WH4959> in his sight;<WH8591> and I shall bring<WH5869> upon myself a curse<WH935> and not a blessing.<WH7045>"
But his mother<WH517> said<WH559> to him, "Your curse<WH7045> be on me, my son;<WH1121> only<WH389> obey<WH8085> my voice,<WH6963> and go,<WH1980> get<WH3947> [them] for me."
So he went<WH1980> and got<WH3947> [them,] and brought<WH935> [them] to his mother;<WH517> and his mother<WH517> made<WH6213> savory<WH4303> food<WH4303> such<WH9201> as his father loved.<WH1>

Then Rebekah<WH7259> took<WH3947> the best<WH9143> garments<WH899> of Esau<WH6215> her elder<WH1419> son,<WH1121> which<WH834> were with her in the house,<WH1004> and put<WH3847> them on Jacob<WH3290> her younger<WH6996> son.<WH1121>
And she put<WH3847> the skins<WH5785> of the kids<WH1423> <WH5795> on his hands<WH3027> and on the smooth<WH9142> part<WH9142> of his neck.<WH6677>
She also gave<WH5414> the savory<WH4303> food<WH4303> and the bread,<WH3899> which<WH834> she had made,<WH6213> to her son<WH1121> Jacob.<WH3290>
Then he came<WH935> to his father and said,<WH1> "My father." And he said,<WH559> "Here<WH1> I am. Who<WH559> are you, my son<WH2009>?"

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to his father, "I am Esau<WH1> your first-born; I have done<WH6215> as you told<WH6213> me. Get<WH1696> up, please,<WH6965> sit<WH4994> and eat<WH3427> of my game,<WH398> that you may bless<WH6718> me."

And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> to his son,<WH1121> "How<WH4100> is it that you have<WH4672> [it] so quickly,<WH4116> my son<WH1121>?" And he said,<WH559> "Because<WH3588> the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> caused [it] to happen<WH7136> to me."

Then Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "Please<WH4994> come<WH5066> close,<WH5066> that I may feel<WH4184> you, my son,<WH1121> whether you are really<WH2088> my son<WH1121> Esau<WH6215> or<WH518> not."

So Jacob<WH3290> came<WH5066> close<WH5066> to Isaac<WH3327> his father, and he felt<WH1> him and said,<WH4959> "The voice<WH559> is the voice<WH6963> of Jacob,<WH6963> but the hands<WH3290> are the hands<WH3027> of Esau.<WH3027>"
And he did not recognize<WH5234> him, because<WH3588> his hands<WH3027> were hairy<WH9617> like his brother<WH251> Esau's hands;<WH3027> so he blessed<WH1288> him.
And he said,<WH559> "Are you really<WH2088> my son<WH1121> Esau<WH6215>?" And he said,<WH559> "I am."

So he said,<WH559> "Bring<WH5066> [it] to me, and I will eat<WH398> of my son's game,<WH6718> that I may bless<WH1288> you." And he brought<WH5066> [it] to him, and he ate;<WH398> he also brought<WH935> him wine<WH3196> and he drank.<WH8354>
Then his father Isaac<WH1> said<WH3327> to him, "Please<WH559> come<WH4994> close<WH5066> and kiss<WH5066> me, my son.<WH5401>"

So he came<WH5066> close<WH5066> and kissed<WH5401> him; and when he smelled<WH9552> the smell<WH7381> of his garments,<WH899> he blessed<WH1288> him and said,<WH559> "See,<WH7200> the smell<WH7381> of my son<WH1121> Is like the smell<WH7381> of a field<WH7704> which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> has blessed;<WH1288>
Now may God<WH430> give<WH5414> you of the dew<WH2919> of heaven,<WH8064> And of the fatness<WH9614> of the earth,<WH776> And an abundance<WH7230> of grain<WH1715> and new<WH8492> wine;<WH8492>

May peoples<WH5971> serve<WH5647> you, And nations<WH3816> bow<WH7812> down<WH7812> to you; Be master<WH1376> of your brothers,<WH251> And may your mother's sons<WH1121> bow<WH7812> down<WH7812> to you. Cursed<WH779> be those who curse<WH779> you, And blessed<WH1288> be those who bless<WH1288> you."

Now it came<WH1961> about, as soon<WH9201> as Isaac<WH3327> had finished<WH3615> blessing<WH1288> Jacob,<WH3290> and Jacob<WH3290> had hardly<WH389> <WH3318> gone<WH3318> out from the presence<WH6440> of Isaac<WH3327> his father, that Esau<WH1> his brother<WH6215> came<WH251> in from his hunting.<WH935>

Then he also<WH1571> made<WH6213> savory<WH4303> food,<WH4303> and brought<WH935> it to his father; and he said<WH1> to his father, "Let my father arise,<WH559> and eat<WH1> of his son's game,<WH1> that you may bless<WH6965> me."
And Isaac<WH3327> his father said<WH1> to him, "Who<WH559> are you?" And he said,<WH4310> "I am your son,<WH559> your first-born, Esau.<WH1121>"

Then Isaac<WH3327> trembled<WH2729> violently<WH2731> <WH1419>,<WH5704> <WH3966> and said,<WH559> "Who<WH4310> was he then<WH645> that hunted<WH6679> game<WH6718> and brought<WH935> [it] to me, so that I ate<WH398> of all<WH3605> [of it] before<WH2962> you came,<WH935> and blessed<WH1288> him? Yes,<WH1571> and he shall be blessed.<WH1288>"

When Esau<WH6215> heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of his father, he cried<WH1> out with an exceedingly<WH6817> great<WH3966> and bitter<WH1419> cry,<WH4751> and said<WH6818> to his father, "Bless<WH559> me, [even] me also,<WH1> O my father!"
And he said,<WH559> "Your brother<WH251> came<WH935> deceitfully,<WH4820> and has taken<WH3947> away your blessing.<WH1293>"

Then he said,<WH559> "Is he not rightly named<WH7121> <WH8034> Jacob,<WH3290> for he has supplanted<WH6117> me these<WH2088> two<WH6471> times<WH6471>? He took<WH3947> away my birthright,<WH1062> and behold,<WH2009> now<WH6258> he has taken<WH3947> away my blessing.<WH1293>" And he said,<WH559> "Have you not reserved<WH680> a blessing<WH1293> for me?"

But Isaac<WH3327> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to Esau,<WH6215> "Behold,<WH2005> I have made<WH7760> him your master,<WH1376> and all<WH3605> his relatives<WH251> I have given<WH5414> to him as servants;<WH5650> and with grain<WH1715> and new<WH8492> wine<WH8492> I have sustained<WH5564> him. Now as for you then,<WH645> what<WH4100> can I do,<WH6213> my son<WH1121>?"

And Esau<WH6215> said<WH559> to his father, "Do you have only one<WH1> blessing,<WH259> my father? Bless<WH1293> me, [even] me also,<WH1> O my father." So Esau<WH1288> lifted<WH1571> his voice<WH1> and wept.<WH6215>

Then Isaac<WH3327> his father answered<WH1> and said<WH6030> to him, "Behold,<WH559> away from the fertility<WH2009> of the earth<WH9614> shall be your dwelling,<WH776> And away from the dew<WH4186> of heaven<WH2919> from above.<WH8064>

"And by your sword<WH2719> you shall live,<WH2421> And your brother<WH251> you shall serve;<WH5647> But it shall come<WH1961> about when<WH9201> you become<WH7300> restless,<WH7300> That you shall break<WH6561> his yoke<WH5923> from your neck.<WH6677>"

So Esau<WH6215> bore<WH7852> a grudge<WH7852> against<WH7852> Jacob<WH3290> because<WH5921> of the blessing<WH1293> with which<WH834> his father had blessed<WH1> him; and Esau<WH1288> said<WH6215> to himself,<WH559> "The days<WH3820> of mourning<WH3117> for my father are near;<WH60> then I will kill<WH1> my brother<WH7126> Jacob.<WH2026>"

Now when the words<WH1697> of her elder<WH1419> son<WH1121> Esau<WH6215> were reported<WH5046> to Rebekah,<WH7259> she sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> her younger<WH6996> son<WH1121> Jacob,<WH3290> and said<WH559> to him, "Behold<WH2009> your brother<WH251> Esau<WH6215> is consoling<WH5162> himself concerning you, [by planning] to kill<WH2026> you.
"Now<WH6258> therefore, my son,<WH1121> obey<WH8085> my voice,<WH6963> and arise,<WH6965> flee<WH1272> to Haran,<WH2771> to my brother<WH251> Laban!<WH3837>
"And stay<WH3427> with him a few<WH259> days,<WH3117> until<WH5704> <WH834> your brother's fury<WH2534> subsides,<WH7725>

until<WH5704> your brother's anger<WH639> against<WH4480> you subsides,<WH7725> and he forgets<WH7911> what<WH834> you did<WH6213> to him. Then I shall send<WH7971> and get<WH3947> you from there.<WH8033> Why<WH4100> should I be bereaved<WH7921> of you both<WH8147> in one<WH259> day<WH3117>? "

And Rebekah<WH7259> said<WH559> to Isaac,<WH3327> "I am tired<WH6973> of living<WH9132> because<WH4480> <WH6440> of the daughters<WH1323> of Heth;<WH2845> if<WH518> Jacob<WH3290> takes<WH3947> a wife<WH802> from the daughters<WH1323> of Heth,<WH2845> like these,<WH428> from the daughters<WH1323> of the land,<WH776> what<WH4100> good will my life<WH9132> be to me?"
